abstract: The move by Microsoft, which values the Nook unit at about $1.7 billion, follows Barnes & Noble’s efforts to examine strategic alternatives for the e-reader business.Through the deal, the two companies will also settle their patent disputes.
snippet: The move by Microsoft, which values the Nook unit at about $1.7 billion, follows Barnes & Noble’s efforts to examine strategic alternatives for the e-reader business.Through the deal, the two companies will also settle their patent disputes.

headline.main: Microsoft to Take Stake in Nook Unit of Barnes & Noble

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced and Julie Bosman

abstract: Also, caution and relative stagnation at News Corporation, and Discovery Channel crashes a Boeing 727.
snippet: Also, caution and relative stagnation at News Corporation, and Discovery Channel crashes a Boeing 727.
lead_paragraph: The e-book wars added a new alliance, the Microsoft-Barnes & Noble joint venture, DealBook reported on Monday. Microsoft has invested $300 million for a 17.6 percent stake in a new Barnes & Noble’s subsidiary composed of its Nook digital-book business and college-texts units; intriguingly, the deal values the subsidiary at $1.7 billion, much more than Barnes & Noble is worth by itself, as The Wall Street Journal noted. Also, as part of the deal, Microsoft has settled its patent dispute with Barnes & Noble, and there will be a Nook application included in the new Windows 8, which is scheduled to have a release preview in early June.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Microsoft Buys Into the Nook, and Radio’s Shrinking Diversity

abstract: The hedge fund Jana Partners and the billionaire Ronald Burkle are among the big winners as shares of Barnes & Noble surge on the Nook news.
snippet: The hedge fund Jana Partners and the billionaire Ronald Burkle are among the big winners as shares of Barnes & Noble surge on the Nook news.
lead_paragraph: Barnes & Noble has finally found a strategic partner for its Nook business — and long-suffering investors are applauding wildly.

headline.main: Barnes & Noble Shares Leap on News of Microsoft Deal

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: April 30, 2012 - Microsoft invests in Barnes & Noble's Nook.
snippet: April 30, 2012 - Microsoft invests in Barnes & Noble's Nook.
lead_paragraph: April 30, 2012 - Microsoft invests in Barnes & Noble's Nook.

headline.main: TimesCast | Microsoft to Invest In Nook

abstract: Microsoft’s investment in Barnes & Noble’s Nook division makes the unit worth $1.7 billion, or nearly double what Barnes & Noble’s entire market capitalization was on Friday.
snippet: Microsoft’s investment in Barnes & Noble’s Nook division makes the unit worth $1.7 billion, or nearly double what Barnes & Noble’s entire market capitalization was on Friday.
lead_paragraph: Of all the details that stand out from Microsoft’s deal for an 18 percent stake in Barnes & Noble’s e-reader unit, perhaps the biggest one is this: the Nook division is now worth $1.7 billion.

headline.main: Barnes & Noble’s Nook Unit Is Worth More Than Its Parent Company

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
